title: You can double the amount of days you have off work in 2020 if you plan it now
text:

We all live for our next holiday and a break from work - as the stream of awful Instagram posts showing a 215 day countdown to Mykonos 2020 will happily testify.

We never seem to be able to stretch our annual leave out to cover us for the year but with a bit of forward planning for 2020 you can nab 59 days away from the nine to five by taking just 27 days leave.

Using them all this way might not leave you much to play with, so if you also have eight weddings to work around next summer you can pick out the ones which work for you and still enjoy a bonus number of days which don't begin with an alarm clock.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

The first dates you need to look out for in the new year is Easter, where taking eight days holiday in April will give you 16 consecutive days off, including weekends, leaving you with a smug out of office between April 4 and April 19.

All you need to do is book off the week leading up to Good Friday on April 10 and the week after Easter Monday on April 13, as reported by Tyla .

The first of May's two bank holidays has been moved this year to celebrate VE Day and will fall on Friday, May 8. Taking off four days from May 4 (Star Wars day) will see you off work for nine days between May 2-10.

The second bank holiday will be on May 25, so booking off between May 26 and 29 will get you another nine consecutive days away and by June your colleagues will start forgetting you work there at all.

(Image: Getty)

Fancy another nine days? Here you go. With the August bank holiday on Monday 31, you just need to book off between September 1-4 and you can lap up some late summer rays or, more likely, escape the rain.

Saving the best until last, seven holiday days over the festive period will give you 16 days straight of Christmas jumpers and pigs in blankets for breakfast.

We'll be off Christmas day on Friday, December 25 and, with Boxing Day falling on a weekend, we'll get Monday, December 28 in lieu.

With New Year's Day on a Friday, booking off December 21-24 and 29-31 will see you away for the entirety of the most wonderful time of the year.

Follow the guide and you'll pretty much be working part time next year.
description: Planning your annual leave in advance can maximise your time out of the office next year
